availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: The seat of Bullitt County, in west-central Kentucky, 18 miles south of Louisville. Established 11 Dec 1793. Became county seat in 1797, when Bullitt County formed. Became a stop on the Louisville and Nashville Railroad when the railroad built, 1855. Confederate forces occupied on 28 Sep 1862. Federal forces retook Shepherdsville on 2 Oct 1862.

bibl.p: Tom Pack, "Shepherdsville," in John E. Kleber, ed., The Kentucky Encyclopedia, (Lexington: The University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 817-818.
